dr.evomodel.coalescent
Class OldAbstractCoalescentLikelihood

java.lang.Object
  dr.inference.model.AbstractModel
      dr.inference.model.AbstractModelLikelihood
          dr.evomodel.coalescent.OldAbstractCoalescentLikelihood
All Implemented Interfaces:
Units, Loggable, Likelihood, Model, ModelListener, StatisticList, VariableListener, MPISerializable, Identifiable, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BayesianSkylineLikelihood, GaussianProcessSkytrackLikelihood, GMRFSkyrideLikelihood, SkylineLikelihood, VariableSkylineLikelihood
public class OldAbstractCoalescentLikelihood
extends AbstractModelLikelihood
implements Units

Forms a base class for a number of coalescent likelihood calculators.

This was the former 'CoalescentLikelihood' which, as of BEAST v1.4.x was replaced as the standard coalescent likelihood by 'NewCoalescentLikelihood'. As this class is used as a base by a number of other classes (i.e., BayesianSkylineLikelihood), I have made this class abstract and removed the parser.

NewCoalescentLikelihood is now CoalesecentLikelihood (it's parser was installed as the default 'coalescentLikelihood' anyway).

Version:
$Id: CoalescentLikelihood.java,v 1.43 2006/07/28 11:27:32 rambaut Exp $
Author:
Andrew Rambaut, Alexei Drummond
See Also:

private  double calculateAnalyticalLogLikelihood()
           
 double calculateIntervalLikelihood(DemographicFunction demoFunction, double width, double timeOfPrevCoal, int lineageCount)
          Returns the likelihood of a given *coalescent* interval
static double calculateIntervalLikelihood(DemographicFunction demogFunction, double width, double timeOfPrevCoal, int lineageCount, OldAbstractCoalescentLikelihood.CoalescentEventType type)
          k - number of lineages N - population size kingsman coalescent: interval to next coalescent event x ~ exp(lambda), where lambda = C(k,2) / N Like(x ; lambda) = lambda * exp(-lambda * x) so Like(N) = (C(k,2)/N) * exp(- x * C(k,2)/N) lg(Like(N)) = lg(C(k,2)) - lg(N) -C(k,2) * x/N

When N changes over time N = N(t) we have lambda(t) = C(k,2)/N(t) and the likelihood equation is Like(t) = lambda(t) * exp(- integral_0^t(lambda(x) dx) )

lg(Like(t)) = -C(k,2) * integral_0^t(1/N(x) dx) + lg(C(k,2)/N(t))

For a sample event, the likelihood is for no event until time t, and is just the first term of the above.

handleVariableChangedEvent

protected void handleVariableChangedEvent(Variable variable,
                                          int index,
                                          Variable.ChangeType type)
Description copied from class: AbstractModel
This method is called whenever a parameter is changed.

It is strongly recommended that the model component sets a "dirty" flag and does no further calculations. Recalculation is typically done when the model component is asked for some information that requires them. This mechanism is 'lazy' so that this method can be safely called multiple times with minimal computational cost.

Specified by:
handleVariableChangedEvent in class AbstractModel

Returns the likelihood of a given *coalescent* interval

calculateIntervalLikelihood

public static double calculateIntervalLikelihood(DemographicFunction demogFunction,
                                                 double width,
                                                 double timeOfPrevCoal,
                                                 int lineageCount,
                                                 OldAbstractCoalescentLikelihood.CoalescentEventType type)
k - number of lineages N - population size kingsman coalescent: interval to next coalescent event x ~ exp(lambda), where lambda = C(k,2) / N Like(x ; lambda) = lambda * exp(-lambda * x) so Like(N) = (C(k,2)/N) * exp(- x * C(k,2)/N) lg(Like(N)) = lg(C(k,2)) - lg(N) -C(k,2) * x/N

When N changes over time N = N(t) we have lambda(t) = C(k,2)/N(t) and the likelihood equation is Like(t) = lambda(t) * exp(- integral_0^t(lambda(x) dx) )

lg(Like(t)) = -C(k,2) * integral_0^t(1/N(x) dx) + lg(C(k,2)/N(t))

For a sample event, the likelihood is for no event until time t, and is just the first term of the above.

Parameters:
demogFunction - the demographic function
width - the size of the coalescent interval
timeOfPrevCoal - the time of previous coalescent event (going backwards in time)
lineageCount - the number of lineages spanning this coalescent interval
type - the type of coalescent event that this interval is terminated by
Returns:
likelihood of a given interval,coalescent or otherwise

calculateIntervalShapeParameter

public final double calculateIntervalShapeParameter(DemographicFunction demogFunction,
                                                    double width,
                                                    double timeOfPrevCoal,
                                                    int lineageCount,
                                                    OldAbstractCoalescentLikelihood.CoalescentEventType type)
Returns:
the exponent of the population size parameter (shape parameter of Gamma distribution) associated to the likelihood for this interval, coalescent or otherwise

calculateIntervalRateParameter

public final double calculateIntervalRateParameter(DemographicFunction demogFunction,
                                                   double width,
                                                   double timeOfPrevCoal,
                                                   int lineageCount,
                                                   OldAbstractCoalescentLikelihood.CoalescentEventType type)
Returns:
the intensity of coalescences (rate parameter, or inverse scale parameter, of Gamma distribution) associated to the likelihood for this interval, coalescent or otherwise

getLambda

private double getLambda()
Returns:
a factor lambda such that the likelihood can be expressed as 1/theta^(n-1) * exp(-lambda/theta). This allows theta to be integrated out analytically. :-)

setupIntervals

public final void setupIntervals()
Recalculates all the intervals from the tree model. GL: made public, to give BayesianSkylineGibbsOperator access

collectAllTimes

private static void collectAllTimes(Tree tree,
                                    NodeRef top,
                                    NodeRef[] excludeBelow,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<ComparableDouble> times,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> childs)
Extract coalescent times and tip information into ArrayList times from tree. Upon return times contain the time of each node in the subtree below top, and at the corrosponding index of childs is the descendent count for that time.

Parameters:
top - the node to start from
excludeBelow - an optional array of nodes to exclude (corresponding subtrees) from density.
tree - given tree
times - array to fill with times
childs - array to fill with descendents count
